meanings.definition: To behead or remove the head from something.
meanings.sent1: The executioner was decollating the criminal.
meanings.sent2: The chef was decollating the fish for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The magician decollated the bouquet of flowers to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The gardener decollated the wilting roses to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent5: The barber decollated the mannequin head to practice new hairstyles.

meanings.definition: To cut off the top or end of something.
meanings.sent1: She was decollating the cake to make it level for frosting.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker was decollating the tree branches for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The tailor decollated the fabric to create a clean edge for sewing.
meanings.sent4: The artist decollated the painting to fit it into a smaller frame.
meanings.sent5: The student decollated the paper to remove the torn edge.

meanings.definition: To separate or remove something from its source or connection.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was decollating the DNA strands for analysis.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was decollating the engine parts for repair.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decollated the incorrect answers from the test paper.
meanings.sent4: The farmer decollated the ripe apples from the tree.
meanings.sent5: The librarian decollated the old books from the collection.
